alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 27 at 6:55PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of West Baton Rouge, northeastern Iberville and southwestern East Baton Rouge Parishes through 730 PM CDT... At 655 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brusly, or near Port Allen, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Baton Rouge, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, St. Gabriel, Addis, Brusly, Maringouin, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Westminster, Old Jefferson, Merrydale, Inniswold, Ramah, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Gardere, Erwinville and Brownfields. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 134 and 168. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 9. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
